thread.title: Apple adds retina display to new iMacs
thread.title_full: Apple adds retina display to new iMacs

title: Apple adds retina display to new iMacs
text:
The revamped iMacs with retina display. (Photo: Apple)
6 CONNECT 28 TWEET 1 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Apple announced Tuesday an update to its line of desktop computers, introducing the retina display made available on its iPhones and iPads.
The 21.5-inch iMac will boast a 4K retina display, while the 27-inch model features a 5K display. The models also boast upgrades to its processors and graphics.
"These are the most stunning iMacs weâ€™ve ever made," says Apple marketing chief Philip Schiller in a statement.
The 21.5-inch iMac starts at $1,099, while the 27-inch starts at $1,799.
The revamped iMacs arrive as sales of personal computers continue to slump. According to third quarter results from research firms IDC and Gartner , shipments fell as the strength of the U.S. dollars made PCs more expensive to purchase in other countries.
Follow Brett Molina on Twitter: @brettmolina23 .
